content: "http://media.barnesandnoble.com/?fr_story=f11df14ca156491cc1f87ac5ae2c92d2d03738e7" FYI, I LOVE Glenn Miller and the Big Band music of those days. journalist and investigator Hunton Downs discussed his research into a cover-up in the death of famed big band leader Glenn Miller. He contended that Miller wasn't killed in a plane accident over the English Channel in 1944-- that was a story made up by the US govt. because they didn't want the public to know how he really died. Downs suggested that Miller, who spoke German, had been enlisted by Eisenhower to serve as a secret envoy, to try and convince some German officers to end the war early and offer terms of armistice.
reply: "http://media.barnesandnoble.com/?fr_story=f11df14ca156491cc1f87ac5ae2c92d2d03738e7" FYI, I LOVE Glenn Miller and the Big Band music of those days. journalist and investigator Hunton Downs discussed his research into a cover-up in the death of famed big band leader Glenn Miller. He contended that Miller wasn't killed in a plane accident over the English Channel in 1944-- that was a story made up by the US govt. because they didn't want the public to know how he really died. Downs suggested that Miller, who spoke German, had been enlisted by Eisenhower to serve as a secret envoy, to try and convince some German officers to end the war early and offer terms of armistice.
title: What Really Happened To Glenn Miller?

content: I too love the Big Band era, particularly the music of Glenn Miller. I caught the "tail end" of a radio program on "Coast to Coast" , offering all kinds of theories about what really happened to him. Who knows for sure? The official records on this may never be declassified. But the fact that there were numerous attempts made by the Germans to end the war honorably (after realizing the war couldn't be won) makes me question if Miller would have been used in this manner.

title: What Really Happened To Glenn Miller?

content: The best explanation of what happened to Miller that I've ever seen made a good case that his plane accidently found itself under a flight of bombers returning from Germany which had been unable to bomb either their primary or secondary targets because of the weather. In such a case, they dumped their bomb loads into the sea rather than land with them. In short, his plane was accidently knocked out of the sky by that bomb load dumping.

title: What Really Happened To Glenn Miller?

content: This sounds like the sort of thing Joe Stalin would believe. He was, till the end of the war, suspicious that the US and England would conclude a separate peace with the nazis. But then again,untill 1943 Stalin would have accepted terms with Hitler. But for der furher it was all or nothing. He would not accept a compromise peace with Stalin. A crash over the Chanel seems the most likely answer to the fate of Miller. Speaking of Hitler, I wonder what he thought of Miller. Hitler, after all, HATED JAZZ music and Miller's big band sound was simply overblown jazz. Compare Chattanooga Choo Choo to the great jazz tune Take the A Train by Duke Ellington.

title: What Really Happened To Glenn Miller?

content: My Grand Father found a brief case with the initials GM on it one day while walking on the beach in Wilmington NC. After it dried he opened it up and found paper work, music papers and photographs of Glenn Miller and some German Officers (Some were SS Officers). He gave me the brief case and I kept it for many years. Then one day I went to a flee market in Melbourne Fl, and traded it for a autograph baseball by Derek Jeter.

title: What Really Happened To Glenn Miller?

content: Years ago, I was playing golf at Admiral Baker Golf Course with my Grandfather and 3 of his retired military buddies. (Background info: Gramps, CWO 2 USN ret. and NSA, another in the group was a USN Capt. Ret. former Blue Angel, and a Col. U.S.M.C. Ret) and this subject came up. It seems the word amongst some (including these guys I was playing golf with) is that Glenn Miller was shot in a Paris "house of ill repute" but; due to the moral climate at the time, coupled with the celebrity status of Mr. Miller (I'm 42, but they tell me Glenn Miller was HUGE during WWII) it would be impossible to release to the public at home due to the effect it would have on Morale back home.... All of these guys I was playing golf with are (IMHO) reliable sources..And I believe them. Duane A. Brinson "on the road" U.S.M.C. 1985-1989
